results.title: Strong and safe
results.brief_description: A program focusing on IV users and HIV issues in the prison environment. Presents information on cleaning needles/syringes, obtaining new needles and syringes, and safe sexual practices by using humorous narrators - “Bleachman” and “Condomware Woman”! Messages are promoted in a positive, simple and practical manner and are geared to reinforcing safe injecting and sexual practices as they relate to IV drug use and the potential transmission of HIV within a prison oriented context.

results.title: Stroke: the fight back
results.brief_description: Gives careful advice on how to care for stroke victims, such as encouraging daily muscle control pertaining to daily independence with the aid of a visiting nurse, physiotherapist, occupational therapist, speech therapy, medical social worker.

results.title: Strictly white collar
results.creator_credit: Norman Savage and W.D. Scott & Co
results.brief_description: Shows the application of methods-time-measurement to office procedures. The object of methods study is to reduce movement to an absolute minimum consistent with maximum speed and efficiency by eliminating, simplifying combining movements and changing their sequences if necessary.

results.title: Strictly for kids
results.brief_description: An experimental film utilizing children’s drawings cut against a background of child-like sounds. We see signs on walls: “Help!”, “I am Mad!” and “I love You”, mixed with drawings of people, faces, the moon and the sun, fish, crabs and a sinking yacht. Music by Costas, tiles by Gus and camera by Fotis.

results.title: Stress, health and you (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Herbert Long and Neil Mawby Productions
results.brief_description: Deals with stress and its effect on our health. Dr. Selye discusses how stress can have both positive and negative causes. An overview that helps people to analyse how their own health is modified by stressful events.

results.title: Stress busters
results.brief_description: This presentation demonstrates Amanda Gore’s easy style of education and entertainment. Her unique humorous style, and passion for messages facilitates behavioural changes and creates rapport with any group, no matter what size. With a background in physiotherapy, psychology and neurolinguistics, she specialises in creativity and new ways of thinking, state of the art selling skils, lifestyle, communication, stress management and relationships. She talks about the how rather than the why, which gives people the skills and motivates them to make behavioural changes. Her constant research means every presentation is fresh. In this video Amanda aims to change your way of thinking about stress in the workplace and at home. She tries to make her audience see that it is a matter of attitude and know-how. This videotape was recorded at the FMRC (Financial Management Research Centre), Armidale, N.S.W. during a a Management Forum for Accountants in May 1993.

results.title: Stress and you: relaxation techniques (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Herbert Long and Neil Mawby Productions
results.brief_description: The human body is a complex network of rhythms that enable us to move grow and adapt. Only when we understand these rhythms can we understand stress and combat it accordingly. Biofeedback, relaxation response and meditation are demonstrated as means of reducing daily tension.

results.title: Stress and you: learning to cope (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Herbert Long and Neil Mawby Productions
results.brief_description: Recognition of stress as a health problem stemming from emotional or environmental pressures. Suggests ways of dealing with stressful situations, including a stress-reducing daily routine designed to avoid potential stress situations.
